description: A court order blocking President Donald Trump’s freeze on trillions of dollars in spending for grants, loans and other financial assistance will remain in place while the government challenges the ruling, an appeals court said.
title: Appeals Court Denies Trump Bid to Pause Spending Freeze Ruling

description: President Donald Trump said he would consider lowering tariff rates imposed on China to secure Beijing’s support for a sale of the US operations of ByteDance Ltd.’s social video platform TikTok to an American company.
title: Trump Says He Could Cut China Tariffs to Secure TikTok Deal

description: President Donald Trump said he plans to impose reciprocal levies on every nation as part of his sweeping tariff push next week, but said the rates would be lower than expected.
title: Trump Says Reciprocal Tariff Plan on All Nations ‘Lenient’

description: Today on the Big Take podcast: Host David Gura interviews Warren about Democrats’ strategy, the Signal chat leak, Elon Musk’s DOGE and more.
title: Senator Elizabeth Warren on the Future of the Democratic Party

description: European leaders are trying to carve out a role for themselves in US-led ceasefire talks over Russia’s war in Ukraine as more than 30 of them gather Thursday for an impromptu defense summit in Paris.
title: Macron Gathers Leaders as Europe Risks Stalling on Ukraine Plan

description: Australia’s center-left government rushed its new round of tax cuts through the parliament in the early hours of Thursday morning, prompting speculation that an election could be called within days.
title: Australia Rushes Through Tax Cuts as Election Speculation Grows

description: The European Union expects the US to apply a double-digit tariff rate across the bloc when President Donald Trump announces a sweeping package of so-called reciprocal duties on April 2.
title: Europe Prepares for Double-Digit Trump Tariffs Next Week

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the reaction among Republicans on the third day of a controversy over a Signal text string among top administration officials. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: GOP Doubts Raised on Trump Team Definition of Classified

description: The Trump administration was dealt a setback in its immigration crackdown when a federal appeals court kept in place a block on deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members to El Salvador.
title: Block on Venezuelan Deportations Upheld by US Appeals Court

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Ukrainian government is reviewing a new economic partnership proposal from the US and hopes the agreement could be signed by the two parties as soon as next week.
title: Bessent Says Ukraine Now Reviewing New Economic Proposal from US

description: Los Angeles strengthened its protections for undocumented immigrants even as President Donald Trump threatens to withhold federal funding from so-called sanctuary cities.
title: Los Angeles Defies Trump With New Sanctuary City Protections

description: A proposal to curb China’s dominance of the global maritime industry would have an out-sized impact on bananas — and aggravate consumers already sensitive to higher prices at the grocery store, according to the largest US supplier of the fruit.
title: Dole Says Port Fees on Chinese Ships Would Hike Banana Prices

description: Thousands of Palestinians demonstrated across the Gaza Strip Wednesday in rare protests against militant group Hamas, the rulers of the embattled territory that triggered a devastating war with Israel.
title: Thousands in Gaza Protest Hamas in Rare Call to End Group’s Rule

description: A White House move to cut 10% of the funding for the agency responsible for semiconductor export controls risks undermining US efforts to stay ahead of China in the AI race, a group of Democratic senators warned.
title: Trump Blocks 10% of Funds for Key Agency in US-China Tech Race

description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Wednesday that Russia cannot set conditions on European support to Ukraine as part of US-led negotiations over a possible ceasefire.
title: Macron Says Russia Can’t Dictate European Support to Ukraine

description: Senator Elizabeth Warren warned Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell could be fired by President Donald Trump as part of a purge she said could disrupt US markets.
title: Elizabeth Warren Warns Fed Chair Powell Could Be Fired by Trump

description: Boeing Co. and Lockheed Martin Corp.’s Vulcan rocket has been certified to launch national security satellites for the US Department of Defense, making it the second company along with Elon Musk’s SpaceX allowed to handle such flights.
title: Boeing-Lockheed’s Vulcan Rocket Cleared to Fly US Spy Satellites

description: The European Union is preparing for a massive round of tariffs set to target the bloc as soon as next week and among its retaliatory options are some of the EU’s most powerful trade-policy tools.
title: Europe Readies Robust Toolbox to Counter Imminent Trump Tariffs

description: Federal workers laid off in connection with President Donald Trump’s anti-DEI executive orders said their terminations were discriminatory and violated their First Amendment rights, in an administrative complaint seeking reinstatement to their jobs.
title: Federal Workers Appeal Trump DEI Layoffs as Biased, Illegal

description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune endorsed a full repeal of the estate tax, identifying the elimination of the levy on the fortunes of some of the wealthiest Americans as Republicans draft a massive economic package.
title: Senate Majority Leader Pushes Estate Tax Repeal in GOP Bill Talks

description: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court for clearance to withhold potentially hundreds of millions of dollars in teacher-training grants, once again seeking emergency help from the high court for the president’s efforts to decimate established federal spending programs.
title: Trump Officials Ask Supreme Court to Halt Teacher Grants

description: President Donald Trump is readying an announcement on auto levies as soon as Wednesday, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that would escalate his fight with global trading partners ahead of a broader tariff push next week.
title: Trump Prepares Auto Tariff Announcement as Soon as Wednesday

description: Four US military personnel and a vehicle went missing in eastern Lithuania, where authorities were carrying out a search-and-rescue operation since Tuesday, the Baltic nation’s armed forces said.
title: Four US Soldiers Go Missing Near Belarus Border in Lithuania

description: Brazil is pressing Mexico to allow pork exports from more meat plants as Latin America’s biggest economy seeks to win new markets by taking advantage of Donald Trump’s trade wars.
title: Brazil Presses Mexico to Import More Pork Before US Tariffs

description: Egypt is set to hike spending by 18% next fiscal year, partly to extend support for the most vulnerable as the North African nation emerges from its worst economic crisis in decades.
title: Egypt Plans 18% Spending Hike With Eye on Wages, Subsidies

description: A majority of judges on a Brazilian Supreme Court panel voted to approve criminal charges against Jair Bolsonaro, setting the stage for the right-wing former president to stand trial over allegations that he attempted a coup after his 2022 election defeat.
title: Bolsonaro to Stand Trial on Coup Charges, Brazil’s Top Court Panel Rules

description: President Donald Trump stressed his desire for the US to annex Greenland ahead of a contentious visit by his vice president, comments likely to further stoke anger in the Danish territory.
title: Trump Insists US Must Own Greenland as Vance Heads There

description: A quarter of a million people, including 50,000 children, will be pushed into relative poverty in the UK by 2030 as a result of Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ planned cuts to the country’s benefits system, according to a government assessment of the policy that risks stoking a rebellion within the governing Labour Party.
title: UK Welfare Reforms to Drive 250,000 More People Into Poverty

description: Tulsi Gabbard, the Director of National Intelligence, reiterated that no classified information was shared in a chat among US officials about a military operation that inadvertently included a journalist.
title: Gabbard Says No Classified Info Was Shared as Chat Texts Are Published

description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said Wednesday that four U.S. soldiers who went missing while training in Lithuania have died, but that he did not yet know the details.
title: Four American Soldiers Missing in Lithuania Have Been Killed, NATO Leader Says

description: The US Supreme Court upheld the federal regulation of built-at-home “ghost gun” kits, backing a rule put in place during the Biden administration to stem what officials said was a torrent of untraceable weapons.
title: Supreme Court Upholds US Regulation of ‘Ghost Gun’ Kits

description: The Congressional Budget Office warned that the federal government could run out of enough money to pay all of its bills on time as soon as August if lawmakers fail to raise or suspend the debt limit.
title: US Treasury Risks Payment Default as Soon as August, CBO Says

description: Turkey’s main opposition party accused the central bank of providing cover for the government in helping to manage the financial fallout from last week’s detention of the mayor of Istanbul.
title: Turkey Opposition Slams Central Bank Over Turmoil Intervention

description: Liberal Party Leader Mark Carney promised a C$2 billion ($1.4 billion) “strategic response fund” to help Canadian auto manufacturing and strengthen a supply chain that’s under threat from US tariffs.
title: Carney Pledges Billions for Canadian Auto Sector in Trade War

description: US Attorney General Pam Bondi denied that the government violated a federal judge’s orders against deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members, instead accusing him of issuing “contradictory” oral and written rulings.
title: Bondi Blames Venezuela Deportation Fight on Judge’s ‘Contradictory’ Orders

description: The Atlantic released a nearly complete transcript of the Signal text chain between top US officials that inadvertently included its top editor, after President Donald Trump and several of those officials sought to play down the severity of the leak.
title: Atlantic Releases Details of Signal Text Chain on Houthi Attacks

description: Investors see the Argentine peso on the verge of devaluation again, with the currency poised to change direction once more after going from one of the worst in the world in 2023 to among the strongest performers last year.
title: Traders Bet on Weaker Argentine Peso as Milei’s IMF Deal Looms

description: Rachel Reeves sought to blame global headwinds for a sharp slowdown in the British economy, as the Chancellor of the Exchequer tries to stabilize the UK’s finances with sweeping spending cuts.
title: Reeves Forced to Slash UK Spending After Growth Forecast Halved

description: Canada’s Conservative Party is proposing a broad tax break for seniors, including allowing them to invest in tax-sheltered retirement accounts for longer, as it tries to regain the advantage in the country’s election.
title: Canada Conservatives Plan Bigger Tax Shelter in Pitch to Seniors

description: Sweden unveiled plans to spend an extra 300 billion kronor ($30 billion) on its armed forces during the next decade to shore up the defenses of the NATO bloc’s newest member.
title: Sweden Plans $30 Billion Military Spending Hike Through 2035

description: Israel’s central bank governor criticized the government’s budget, which was approved by parliament on Tuesday, saying it will fail to bring down debt quickly enough after a surge induced by 18 months of war.
title: Israel’s Central Bank Chief Criticizes Netanyahu’s Budget

description: UK housing rents are growing at the slowest pace since 2023, according to official data, bringing some relief to hard-pressed tenants.
title: UK Housing Rents Increase at Slowest Annual Pace Since 2023

description: Sudan’s army recaptured Khartoum’s international airport, an official said, edging closer to routing the Rapid Support Forces from the capital in what would be a turning point in the two-year civil war.
title: Sudanese Army Says Capital’s Airport Recaptured From Militia

description: Russia is scheduled to receive deliveries of chemical ingredients critical to the manufacture of explosives, ordered from fertilizer companies that have largely escaped international sanctions, according to documents seen by Bloomberg.
title: Russian Explosive Makers Use Fertilizer Firms to Blunt Sanctions

description: Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed invited residents of the restive Tigray province to nominate a new leader, in a bid to ease mounting tensions in the northern region that threaten to reignite a civil war.
title: Ethiopia Leader Asks Tigray to Propose New Head to Ease Tensions

description: Norway’s central bank will probably hold off on delivering its first cut in borrowing costs for five years this week, thwarted by resurgent inflation.
title: Norway’s Rate-Cut Plans Get Foiled by Inflation

description: The latest effort to get the US Supreme Court to restrain government regulation has an unlikely opponent: President Donald Trump.
title: Trump Tempers Anti-Regulation Push to Back FCC at Supreme Court

description: European officials say that Donald Trump is soon going to be faced with a difficult decision in his push to end Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Europe Sees Putin Forcing Trump Into a Tough Choice on Ukraine

description: Turkey’s nascent rate-cutting cycle may be placed on hold after a tumultuous week in the country’s financial markets.
title: Morgan Stanley, JPMorgan Rule Out a Turkey Rate Cut in April

description: President Xi Jinping is making China’s presence more felt across the Indo-Pacific region by testing US allies on sensitive issues, as Donald Trump’s attention is taken up elsewhere.
title: Xi Tests US Allies in Indo-Pacific as Trump Focuses Elsewhere

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: JD Vance Amplifies the Bizarre in Greenland Saga

description: Germany’s government won a crucial court ruling in a case that could have stripped as much as €75 billion ($81 billion) of tax income from the public coffers.
title: German Top Court Clears €75 Billion Solidarity Surcharge Tax

description: There’s one top official that’s been visiting Russia so often since Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine that it’s raised suspicion among his fellow European diplomats. It’s Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto and he is in Moscow again today.
title: Europeans Are Wary of Orban Loyalist’s Frequent Trips to Moscow

description: US Vice President JD Vance and his wife Usha revised their travel plans for Greenland this week, relieving some of the growing anxiety in Denmark over President Donald Trump’s takeover interest.
title: US Officials’ Scaled-Back Greenland Tour Offers Denmark Relief

description: China is running a trade surplus that the world economy can’t “live with,” former US President Bill Clinton’s top trade official said, warning its exports would face new roadblocks without fixing the domestic causes fueling the imbalances.
title: China’s Trade Surplus Too Big to Accept, Ex-Top US Official Says

description: China’s economy got off to a good start this year and authorities are ready to deploy more stimulus if growth loses momentum, a center bank adviser said.
title: China Will Ramp Up Stimulus If Growth Falters, PBOC Adviser Says

description: A Tokyo court found a former judge guilty of insider trading, in a verdict that comes amid a string of financial scandals at banks as well as the stock exchange.
title: Former Japanese Judge Found Guilty in Insider Trading Case

description: UK inflation unexpectedly cooled, strengthening the case for the Bank of England to cut interest rates again in May and providing a morale boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ahead of a key economic statement Wednesday.
title: UK Inflation Cools Unexpectedly in Boon for Reeves and Rate Cuts

description: A South Korean court has ruled that the country’s main opposition leader Lee Jae-myung did not violate election laws, overturning a lower court’s decision and bolstering his standing as a potential presidential front-runner.
title: South Korea Court Sides With Opposition Leader in Election Case

description: US President Donald Trump praised Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, giving his endorsement to a government that’s faced a week of protests at home and an exodus of foreign capital amid a crackdown on the opposition.
title: Erdogan Wins Trump Praise Amid Crackdown That’s Rattled Markets

description: The blue-helmeted United Nations peacekeepers are mostly gone, replaced by thousands of Israeli troops in nine new bases with vistas all the way to Damascus. A six-meter-deep (20-foot) trench is being dug out of the volcanic rock to trap anything rolling toward Israel.
title: Israel Deploys Troops in Syria as Part of New Defense Doctrine

description: In the year since Stefan Walter has been in charge of Switzerland’s financial regulator, he’s made a name for himself among the bankers he oversees.
title: Switzerland’s Finance Sheriff Takes on UBS and Banking Elite

description: Friedrich Merz is facing a critical moment in his bid to become German chancellor, as disgruntled fellow conservatives worry he’s making too many concessions.
title: Merz’s Next Big Test Is to Win Over German Conservative Skeptics

description: Sri Lanka’s new government will be restricted in how much it can spend for at least the next two years, the prime minister said, as it looks to balance campaign pledges to unwind tax increases and other austerity measures against limits set by its $3 billion bailout program.
title: Sri Lanka’s Prime Minister Sees Fragile Economy Through 2028

description: Canada and India are taking steps to cool an escalation of diplomatic tensions that included harsh accusations and recriminations as both sides look to strengthen trade ties to counter US tariff threats.
title: Canada and India Look to Reset Ties in Counter to Trump’s Duties

description: Billionaire Ong Beng Seng will plead guilty at a later date than originally expected in a case related to a former Singapore government minister who was jailed for obtaining gifts from the property tycoon.
title: Billionaire Ong’s Singapore Guilty Plea Delayed on Doctor Report

description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra survived a no-confidence vote in parliament after a two-day debate where the opposition targeted her over her father’s alleged influence on the government and its mismanagement of the economy.
title: Thai PM Survives No-Confidence Vote After Thaksin Scrutiny

description: Mark Carney recruited Timothy Hodgson, a former Goldman Sachs banker who was an adviser to him at the Bank of Canada, to run for the Liberal Party in the country’s election.
title: Carney Recruits Ex-Goldman Banker Hodgson for Political Run

description: Former European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said Germany’s decision to ramp up defense spending is a “game changer” but warned there are risks when it comes to how it’s implemented.
title: Draghi Calls Germany’s Shift on Defense Spending ‘Game Changer’

description: CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd.’s plan to sell two Panama ports to a BlackRock Inc.-led group is moving ahead as scheduled, people familiar with the matter said, in a sign that negotiations have not yet been disrupted by China’s anger over the transaction.
title: CK Hutchison Said to Proceed With Port Deal Amid China Ire

description: A Chinese influencer facing deportation from Taiwan for backing a military seizure of the self-run democracy has returned to her country — an episode that comes as Taipei steps up efforts to counter Beijing’s propaganda.
title: China Influencer Forced to Leave Taiwan for Supporting Invasion

description: President Donald Trump said he plans to limit exceptions to his tariff push, the latest cryptic hint about a planned April 2 announcement of reciprocal duties on global trading partners.
title: Trump Says He Doesn’t Want ‘Too Many’ Exceptions in Tariff Push

description: President Donald Trump said it was possible that Vladimir Putin was avoiding finalizing a ceasefire agreement, but that he remained confident the Russian leader intended to strike a deal.
title: Trump Says It’s Possible Putin Is Dragging His Feet on Ceasefire

description: US tariffs on copper imports could be coming within several weeks, months earlier than the deadline for a decision, according to people familiar with the matter. Copper traded in New York rose to a record.
title: Trump May Implement Copper Import Tariffs Within Weeks

description: The US canceled two aid projects in Cambodia in late February — one to encourage child literacy and another to improve nutrition and development for kids under five. A week later, China’s aid agency announced funding for programs to achieve almost identical goals.
title: China Swoops In to Replace Asian USAID Projects Axed by Trump

description: Five members of President Donald Trump’s cabinet were accused in a lawsuit of violating US laws meant to safeguard government records by using the encrypted messaging platform Signal to communicate about official business.
title: Trump Cabinet Officials in Group Chat Flap Face a Lawsuit
